update.description:
### Main changes

* This allows Iface to work without a Gui (issue #140) using events for the communication between them.

* I also unified all 4 emitters into a single one, partially addressing issue #136.

* Removed `LogPlay` from `Gui` as a first step towards using it independently

### Other smaller changes

* Moved test fixture loading to `spec_helper.js`
* Run eslint for tests
* Documented gziface

### TODO

This is mostly a proposal, if there are no objections to the changes here, I'd like to add a few more tests
update.title: Unify emitters, decouple Iface and Gui

pullrequest.title: Unify emitters, decouple Iface and Gui

content.raw:
Ok, so that issue was introduced when I moved from `click` to `on('click'` to get the tests to pass. I still have no idea why event delegation wasn't working during normal use but worked for the tests, and after much debugging I decided to revert back to `click` and change the test instead (ac62a28).

The key to get the test working was to only allow jQuery to execute its ready function (where we setup a bunch of `click`s) after the test fixture had been loaded. And that was way more complicated than I expected.
content.html:
Ok, so that issue was introduced when I moved from click to on('click' to get the tests to pass. I still have no idea why event delegation wasn't working during normal use but worked for the tests, and after much debugging I decided to revert back to click and change the test instead (ac62a28).

The key to get the test working was to only allow jQuery to execute its ready function (where we setup a bunch of clicks) after the test fixture had been loaded. And that was way more complicated than I expected.

  2. Click on the translate mode button
  3. Click on the box - the translate markers are not attached to it

I'm looking into it

pull_request.title: Unify emitters, decouple Iface and Gui

pullrequest.title: Unify emitters, decouple Iface and Gui

content.raw:
I added some checks that global events are being emitted to `gzgui_test` in d9a39d5. 

While doing it, I realized the existing tests were never triggering our callbacks. That was happening because the test fixture is dynamically created after the callbacks were setup on gzgui, and JQuery's `click` doesn't work with dynamically created elements. So I changed the callbacks being tested to use `on.('click')`, which works for the test.
content.html:
I added some checks that global events are being emitted to gzgui_test in d9a39d5.

While doing it, I realized the existing tests were never triggering our callbacks. That was happening because the test fixture is dynamically created after the callbacks were setup on gzgui, and JQuery's click doesn't work with dynamically created elements. So I changed the callbacks being tested to use on.('click'), which works for the test.
